intro: Eleocharis tenuiculmis, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow water areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. It is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in saturated or flooded soils. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
